org.springframework.web.socket

Interface WebSocketSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConfigurableWebSocketSession
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHttpSockJsSession, AbstractSockJsSession, AbstractWebSocketSesssionAdapter, JettyWebSocketSessionAdapter, PollingSockJsSession, StandardWebSocketSessionAdapter, StreamingSockJsSession, WebSocketServerSockJsSession

    public interface WebSocketSession
    A WebSocket session abstraction. Allows sending messages over a WebSocket connection and closing it.
    Since:
    4.0
    Author:
    Rossen Stoyanchev

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the WebSocket connection with status 1000, i.e.
      void close(CloseStatus status)
      Close the WebSocket connection with the given close status.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Return a unique session identifier.
      java.security.Principal getPrincipal()
      Return a Principal instance containing the name of the authenticated user.
      java.lang.String getRemoteAddress()
      Return the IP address of the endpoint on the other end.
      java.lang.String getRemoteHostName()
      Return the host name of the endpoint on the other end.
      java.net.URI getUri()
      Return the URI used to open the WebSocket connection.
      boolean isOpen()
      Return whether the connection is still open.
      boolean isSecure()
      Return whether the underlying socket is using a secure transport.
      void sendMessage(WebSocketMessage<?> message)
      Send a WebSocket message either TextMessage or BinaryMessage.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Return a unique session identifier.

      • getUri

        java.net.URI getUri()
        Return the URI used to open the WebSocket connection.

      • isSecure

        boolean isSecure()
        Return whether the underlying socket is using a secure transport.

      • getPrincipal

        java.security.Principal getPrincipal()
        Return a Principal instance containing the name of the authenticated user. If the user has not been authenticated, the method returns null.

      • getRemoteHostName

        java.lang.String getRemoteHostName()
        Return the host name of the endpoint on the other end.

      • getRemoteAddress

        java.lang.String getRemoteAddress()
        Return the IP address of the endpoint on the other end.

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Return whether the connection is still open.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(WebSocketMessage<?> message)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Send a WebSocket message either TextMessage or BinaryMessage.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the WebSocket connection with status 1000, i.e. equivalent to: 
         session.close(CloseStatus.NORMAL);
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        void close(CloseStatus status)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the WebSocket connection with the given close status.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
